title: AB 1684
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The Government Code is amended to give the department the power to establish offices, appoint necessary personnel, utilize services of other departments, and create rules for investigation and dispute resolution. The Government Code is amended to give the department the power to establish offices, appoint necessary personnel, utilize services of other departments, and create rules for investigation and dispute resolution. The department is authorized to receive, investigate, conciliate, mediate, and prosecute complaints alleging unlawful practices under Chapter 6 and violations of specific sections of the Civil Code. The department is empowered to investigate complaints alleging violations of specific sections of the Penal Code and Civil Code. It can issue subpoenas for witness testimony and document production in matters under investigation. The department has the authority to administer oaths, examine witnesses under oath, take evidence, issue written interrogatories, request production of documents, and bring civil actions before state and federal trial courts. The department is responsible for issuing publications to promote goodwill and prevent discrimination in employment and housing based on various factors. It also approves and enforces nondiscrimination programs, conducts mediations, and submits annual reports to the Governor and Legislature. If an accusation issued under former Section 12965 includes a prayer for damages for emotional injuries or administrative fines, the department may withdraw the accusation and bring a civil action in superior court. If an accusation was issued under former Section 12981, the department may withdraw it with consent and bring a civil action in superior court. If removal to court is not feasible, the Office of Administrative Hearings will adjudicate the administrative action. The director or designee shall consult with the Attorney General on any Code of Civil Procedure challenge to a decision of the Fair Employment and Housing Commission.
